revised_title: Roman Inscription Found at Malton in Yorkshire: A Historical Analysis
tldr: The author presents a historical analysis of a Roman inscription found in Malton, Yorkshire, in 1753. The inscription, dedicated to Aurelius Macrinus, a member of the Roman cavalry known as equites singulares, provides insight into the life and history of Roman Britain. The author discusses the possible origin and role of the equites singulares and the significance of the inscription in the context of Roman and British history.
